snippet: Jabbar Collins spent 16 years in prison for the 1994 killing of an Orthodox rabbi. His case exposed several questionable tactics used by the Brooklyn district attorney’s office.
abstract: Jabbar Collins, who spent 16 years in prison for 1994 murder of Rabbi Abraham Pollack, crime he did not commit, reaches $10 million settlement with New York City; case, one of several the city has settled in 2014, exposes questionable tactics used by Brooklyn district attorney's office, then led by Charles J Hynes.
lead_paragraph: Jabbar Collins spent 16 years in prison for the 1994 killing of an Orthodox rabbi. His case exposed several questionable tactics used by the Brooklyn district attorney’s office.

headline.main: Exonerated Man Reaches $10 Million Deal With New York City
headline.print_headline: Exonerated Man Reaches $10 Million Deal With City
